body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Philip Carroll states, that he was fined $10. on an ordinance warrant in the city Court of Louisville, for selling beer without license. Mr Carroll is a weakly_sickly man and is not able to do any business, and is very poor. Mrs Carroll, is very clever & industrious, woman, and by her attention to their Grocery_supports the family He respectfully asks your Excellency to remit the fine.
July. 13th 1861
I join with petitioner and recommend a remission of the above mentioned fine

I know Mrs Carroll she is a verry worthy & Industrious Woman, I have learned from her neighbors that her husband is in feeble health & unable to Labor & that she supports her family by her own Exertions

Louisville City Court
$10. } Misdemeanor
P. Carroll
